festival.name: Coachella Music Festival
festival.description: The Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival is an annual music and arts festival held at the Empire Polo Club in Indio, California, in the Coachella Valley in the Colorado Desert. It was co-founded by Paul Tollett and Rick Van Santen in 1999, and is organized by Goldenvoice, a subsidiary of AEG Presents. The event features musical artists from many genres of music, including rock, pop, indie, hip hop, and electronic dance music, as well as art installations and sculptures.

additional_info.covid_policy: Proof of vaccination or a negative COVID-19 test result is required for entry. Masks are recommended but not mandatory.

festival.name: Glastonbury Festival
festival.description: The Glastonbury Festival of Contemporary Performing Arts is one of the most famous music and performing arts festivals in the world, known for its diverse lineup of music, comedy, dance, theatre, circus, cabaret, and other arts. Founded by Michael Eavis in 1970, it is held at Worthy Farm in Pilton, Somerset. Along with considerable live acts, the festival hosts a wide array of attractions, including political, social, and environmental activism. Glastonbury is also renowned for its mud if it rains.

additional_info.covid_policy: Attendees are advised to check the festival website for the latest health and safety guidelines prior to the event.
